{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents mention ocular involvement in HIV infection, including cotton wool spots, retinal hemorrhage in cytomegalovirus retinitis, and conjunctival Kaposi's sarcoma. Aspergillus and penicillium are the most commonly seen species among the isolated fungal strain.
